meanings.def: giving reason to believe that good things will happen; likely to be successful
examples: This young musician has a bright future.
Prospects for the coming year look bright.
a bright start to the week
The factory's future now looks bright.
The war dimmed hopes of a rising market after a bright start to the year.
the brightest pupil in the class

meanings.def: a lively and intelligent person, especially somebody young
examples: Some bright spark (= stupid person) left the tap running all night.

meanings.def: a good or pleasant part of something that is unpleasant or bad in all other ways
examples: The win last week was the only bright spot in their last ten games.
The birth of my son was the one bright spot in a terrible year.

meanings.def: to be cheerful or positive about a bad situation, for example by thinking only of the advantages and not the disadvantages
examples: Look on the bright side. You managed to do more than I did.
You're up bright and early today!
Although he grew up in the country, he's always had a taste for the bright lights.
